reviews.text: I stayed here with three colleagues while we were in Charleston for a conference. We all had separate rooms, each of which were exceptional. Exceptionally large rooms, some with separate sitting areas separated by stairs, or by a wall and a door. Television in both the bedroom and the sitting room. All rooms with king sized beds. Some are 4 poster antique beds! The owners took great care in creating a luxury of the past. Antiques and high quality artwork adorn the entire property. Mini refrigerators, microwaves, and sinks are in each room. I understand that this is the "low" season in Charleston, but I would still expect to pay over $200 a night based on the size of the room alone. Our reservations were $169/night. They offer a complimentary breakfast every morning, consisting of fresh fruit, cereal, oatmeal, bagels, muffins, etc, and offers a "happy hour" in the afternoon with complimentary wine, cheese, crackers, and various dips (request that they make the artichoke dip for a night while you're there!). If ever I make plans to go to charleston for fun, I will definately consider booking here. We're already on the books for next year's conference.
reviews.title: Like going back in time, but with all the modern conveniences

reviews.text: The B&B is nice, and not too far, (10 -15 min. walking distance) from the center of the city, but it lacked some key ammenities, like a hot-tub/jaccuzi. We had a room with a nice King size bed, but the rest of the room seemed to fail to keep up as far as decoration / presentation. We paid $300 a night, and in our opinion, it was overpriced since there were no more key ammenties other than a nice bed.
reviews.title: Major noise problems!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cute, but not practical for sleeping! This hotel spent a lot of money in decor, but very little thought went into the basics of what makes a good nights sleep - soundproofing! Between the noise coming from both adjoining rooms, lots of street noise and trucks backing up (beep, beep, beep), noise from the atrium, noise from the deck patio, we were SO ready to get home and actually get some sleep! We got $10 off at checkout in compensation for the noise - woohoo! Not worth the money in my opinion, and would choose to stay somewhere else next time.
reviews.title: Nice, but sound travels!

likes.disliked: — Breakfast was subpar, and we heard too much noise in our room.

reviews.text: The Ansonborough Inn was easily one of the most unique Inns/hotels I've ever stayed at. The rooms are huge, plenty of area to strecth out and was very quiet. We actually had a two month old baby with us and even with her loudest crying she could not be heard outside our room. (I checked just to make sure). The atrium is fantastic, it's like stepping back into time. The roof top is also great allowing one to see all sorts of views. I have nothing bad to say about this Inn. And to the person who wrote the review about bad pillows and hearing traffic along a busy road, well....I'd dismiss that review pretty fast. Location is great, only a couple of blocks from all sorts of shopping and dining. When we come back to visit this wonderful city, we'll definetly being staying at the Ansonborough Inn.
reviews.title: Tremendous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance' and I had planned a last minute trip to Charleston. The day before our arrival I stumbled accross their website and called them directly to make arrangements. I was quoted a reasonable price of 129.00 an night plus a 10.00 a day parking fee. When we got there everyone was very hospitable, any and every question that I had, they answered. I needed assistance with finding a jazz club, they got on the internet and googled a location for me. I needed a recommendation for dinner, she showed me where the menus they had were located and even said that if I needed them to make a reservation for us they would handle it. Our room was perfect. We stayed in a loft and it was clean, tidy, and upbove satisfactory. The wine and cheese social was good. The rooftop at night was beautiful with all the lights overlooking the city. He and I were the only people up there and it was very romantic. The bed including the pillows were comfortable. At check out my bill was the amount that was quoted to me. All these complaints by these other patrons.... I have no idea what they're talking about!! No matter what life's circumstances are, you have to choose to enjoy what's been bestoyed upon you. As for the powers that be at the Ansonborough Inn, you can't please everybody, but you sure pleased us!! We'll be back!! Thank you sooo much!!

reviews.text: I usually would not take the time to write of even comment , but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Ansonborough Inn, and would highly recommend any persons searching for a quaint inn in Charleston to stay here. We have stayed at numerous other locations in the downtown area, and this will definitely be our yearly getaway. The sizeable rooms and sophisticated décor was such a pleasure, as was the in room “art gallery”. The front desk staff was wonderful, and even went out of their way to give us wine and cheese, since we just missed it. The location was a comfortable walking distance to restaurants and shops. We look forward to our next visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went South to check out Savannah and Charleston along with seaside areas for retirement possibilities - no set plans but when arrived in Charleston remembered the Ansonborough from web searches beforehand! No disappointment - beautiful facility - great rooms - great location - Harris Teeter across the street - downtown about 4 block walk - walked to church in the rain ;-) (loaned us an umbrella) beautiful historic homes and gardens to wander by and admire within a 3 block radius! but best of all - just thoroughly enjoyed the uniqueness of the inn, a restored warehouse but absolutely gorgeous - their beautiful rooms (and each one is different) with their special appointments, the hospitality of staff, along with a delightful free wine & cheese, hors d'oeuvres, hot breakfast, the beautiful deck upstairs overlooking the city & harbor! Service and hospitality a definite A+++
reviews.title: 36th Anniversary - Loved the Ansonborough Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ansonborough Inn is truly a rare find! My husband and I searched the internet for the perfect place to stay for a Christmas getaway gift to each other. After looking at many properties in Charleston, we finally decided on the Ansonborough since they were able to offer a AAA discount rate with our card which made the price much less than most of the places in the city. We were so glad we did! It all had such wonderful ambience and you could see the history in every inch of the inn. As soon as you walk into the inn to the reception area, you can't help but appreciate the beauty of the place.

reviews.title: Exceeded our expectations

likes.disliked: — Pillows were a little small and hard (although there were plenty of them)

reviews.text: Something like 775 sq. ft. and above and beyond what we expected. When you entered the suite there was an entry area with a table and chairs, sink, microwave, refrigerator area and off from this area was the HUGE tiled bathroom. There was a small set of stairs to the upper level living room area with beautiful furniture, exposed brick walls and high gorgeous wood beamed ceilings. The separate bedroom had a beautiful 4 poster king sized bed. There were 3 candlebulb chandeliers, one in the bedroom, one in the living room area and one in the entryway area. There are gorgeous paintings throughout the inn and the suites.

likes.disliked: — Being right off the lobby - noisy in the morning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in one of the recently remodeled King Studio Suites, and it was stunning. Vaulted rafter ceilings, exposed brick walls, beautiful oil paintings, leather sofa, comfy king bed with fluffy down comforter, and very clean marble bath. It is obvious they have paid attention to the little things here! Staff was also courteous, and I am grateful to the woman who arranged my reservation there on the phone for recommending this suite.
reviews.title: Very pleased!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights at the Ansonborough and couldn't have been happier. As others have stated it's a unique property and quite lovely inside. Our room was a corner unit on the 2nd floor and very roomy (only 2 of us). I wasn't sure what to expect as some reviews weren't that great, but from the moment we arrived to a most-helpful Carrie and Brianna at the front desk, to the time we left, the staff were wonderful. Our room was very clean and our maid service was always quick and thorough. I will admit that the walls did seem a little thin but it wasn't enough to be bothersome to us. The daily free wine/cheese hour was fantastic - we're still talking about the pimento cheese and breakfast was very good too. Having walked all over Charleston I thought the location was perfect. There are closer places but it's really quite centrally located if you're into seeing all the sites and seemed much quieter than staying somewhere closer to the market area. It was also convenient to have a grocery store across the street. We'd definately go back to this Inn!!
reviews.title: Wonderful experience and great location!
Good base for exploring this fabulous city
reviews.text: I was a little worried when we arrived and realised the hotel was opposite a 24 hour supermarket and across the road from working docks but, once you're inside it makes no difference. The building is really quirky, the staff are low-key (which suits us Brits totally) and the room we stayed in (top floor, single story room) was perfect - large, clean, free wi-fi. I was quite surprised at the age of all the other guests but will assume there was a pensioners event in the city as we were the youngest guests by decades! We didn't attend the cheese and wine evenings but breakfast was good and the roof terrace was a perfect spot to sit in the late afternoon sun and read. We both fell in love with Charleston - it really is a wonderful city.

Our room was not very clean to begin with.....we found children's clothing in the closet and there was dust all over. It was my mother and myself so I was sleeping in the pull-out couch. Well, half the bed was broken so I kept falling through to the floor. I knew it was going to be a long night and sure enough, I could hear every word spoken in the next room until late into the night.
